revised_title: Analyzing the Effects of Quantal Variance on Amplitude Histograms in Synaptic Responses
tldr: The authors analyze the effects of quantal variance on amplitude histograms in synaptic responses, specifically focusing on Type I and Type II quantal variance. They find that Type II quantal variance can cause the variance of successive peaks in amplitude histograms to decrease, rather than increase, leading to "apparent negative quantal variance." This study provides a better understanding of the underlying factors affecting synaptic transmission in the central nervous system.
